title: Gilligan
guest_stars: Bob Denver, Dawn Wells, Russell Johnson
synopsis: Three stranded castaways, Bob Denver (Gilligan), Dawn Wells (Mary Ann) and Russell Johnson (The Professor), take their turns in the video monitor. Zorak declares, "I am the lone locust of the apocalypse. Think of me when you look to the night sky."

transcript.speaker: Choose a format
transcript.dialogue: Regular Table Indented Condensed

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (Invisos in) Greetings. I am Space Ghost. You just saw Zorak when he was guest starring on "Gilligan's Island" back in the 60's. Hey Zorak! That was pretty good!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: I'm a dues paying member of The Screen Locusts Guild.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Zorak's been bugging me, bugging me, get it? to get these guys on the show. So tonight we have three getaways from "Gilligan's Island".

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: That's "castaways", you s... uh...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Whatever.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (Invisos in to desk) (laughs) Buggin' me. Alrighty! My first guest...

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Er, Space Ghost?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: What?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Space Ghost?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: What, Zorak?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Space Ghost.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: What?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: What?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: What?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: What?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: What?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Nothin'.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Grrrrr...

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (monitor lowers with video clip of locust swarm) You know, Zorak is a locust. Locusts are known to swarm about and leave their shells stuck to trees.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (looking at monitor) Mom?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: They carry diseases like a fly. They are evil, green, and occasionally played the heavy in late 70's films.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: My first guest is Gilligan himself, welcome Bob Denver!

transcript.speaker: Bob Denver
transcript.dialogue: (monitor lowers again, Bob's image appears) Right, I'm ready.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Citizen Bob, you have a book out, "Gilligan, Maynard and Me." Tell us about it.

transcript.speaker: Bob Denver
transcript.dialogue: Well, it's a book about one character I played, Maynard G. Krebs, on a series called "Dobie Gillis", and then it's about Gilligan, and all the funny things that happened when I was shooting, you know, both shows.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Citizen, could I affectionately call you Gilligan?

transcript.speaker: Bob Denver
transcript.dialogue: (laughs) Sure.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Fine! Gilligan! Yes, I rather like that!

transcript.speaker: Bob Denver
transcript.dialogue: Well, good for you! (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Alrighty! When you did "The Harlem Globetrotters on Gilligan's Island," did you think the writers had gone far enough with the idea?

transcript.speaker: Gilligan
transcript.dialogue: I think so, I think it was like, the crowning achievement was to have the Harlem Globetrotters on Gilligan's Island.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I see. You were on that island for 15 years, how did you recharge the batteries for that radio?

transcript.speaker: Gilligan
transcript.dialogue: It was a TV show, you know, we knew that, we didn't believe that we were really on an island, you know, uh, so...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: But you can fly like you did on the show, correct?

transcript.speaker: Gilligan
transcript.dialogue: Oh, well, you know, I guess...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: And that "To Be or Not To Be" song, you really sang that, didn't you?

transcript.speaker: Gilligan
transcript.dialogue: No, I'm afraid I can't...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Sing it!

transcript.speaker: Gilligan
transcript.dialogue: No, no, I can't sing. Sorry.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: What are ya, too important to sing it now, you got a cookbook like Mary Ann?

transcript.speaker: Gilligan
transcript.dialogue: Oh...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Sing the "To Be or Not To Be" song!

transcript.speaker: Gilligan
transcript.dialogue: (sings) "To be or not to be, that is the question that I" ... that's as far as I can go. (laughs) I have to get my book out, and look up the words.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: We have a clip from that... But, we're not going to show it. (chuckles) Say, "to be or not to be", That's Shakespeare, isn't it?

transcript.speaker: Gilligan
transcript.dialogue: Yes, from "Hamlet".

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Don't you think "Hamlet" would have been funnier if they were stranded on a desert island?

transcript.speaker: Gilligan
transcript.dialogue: (laughs) No, I don't think so.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Oh, I do.

transcript.speaker: Gilligan
transcript.dialogue: Oh, well, I think it's up to, you know, your taste there, you know, Mr. Space Ghost. I mean, it's, I think it's just good the way it is.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Hey, listen to me! I'm talking Shakespeare with Gilligan!

transcript.speaker: Postman
transcript.dialogue: Package for Space Ghost.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Oh, look! It's from Zorak!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Ouch!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (evil laugh)
INTERRUPT FEED

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (still laughing)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (not realizing cameras are on) You just keep it up Zorak!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Space Ghost, we're back...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I don't care that we're back! Zorak, I'll blister your butt so bad...

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Space Ghost, we're back!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Moltar! Don't these cameras have those little red thingies on 'em? ("Surplus Cheese" info is on the set monitor)

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: No!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Well they should! (clears throat) My next castaway played Mary Ann, please welcome Dawn Wells!

transcript.speaker: Dawn Wells
transcript.dialogue: (appears on the monitor) So far so good.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Welcome, Dawn.

transcript.speaker: Dawn Wells
transcript.dialogue: Hello!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Bob Denver says Gilligan's Island wasn't real. What do you say?

transcript.speaker: Dawn Wells
transcript.dialogue: That's true! It's not real!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Get out!

transcript.speaker: Dawn Wells
transcript.dialogue: It's overwhelming, isn't it?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: What's overwhelming?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: The fact that the show wasn't real.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: No, I mean "overwhelming", what does it mean?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Uh, it's an adjective, uh, means extreme or great.

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (in control room) It means you're an idiot.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I see, so Dawn, what have you been up to?

transcript.speaker: Dawn Wells
transcript.dialogue: Mary Ann's been writing a cookbook. A "Gilligan's Island" cookbook. I call it, uh, "Recipes and Reminiscence".

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Does Mary Ann have any recipes for Tina Louise humble pie?

transcript.speaker: Dawn Wells
transcript.dialogue: (laughs) Not a lot of that. No! There some Tina Louise recipes, however. Some "Ginger Snaps" and a few of those. (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: What's Tina's problem?

transcript.speaker: Dawn Wells
transcript.dialogue: I don't think she had one. I just don't think she's real happy with, um, always being connected with "Gilligan's Island", I think Tina's more serious about her dramatic career than a comedy career.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: And who isn't? Eh, Dawn, which episode is your favorite?

transcript.speaker: Dawn Wells
transcript.dialogue: I think the one to do, to film, was the, was the "Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde" episode and it was, I got to be an Eliza Doodle character with a cockney accent... But I think the one I like to watch most was the "Hamlet".

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Zorak was in that one, remember?

transcript.speaker: Dawn Wells
transcript.dialogue: Oh yes.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: He's a locust.

transcript.speaker: Dawn Wells
transcript.dialogue: Sexy kinda guy.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Gilligan and I were just talking Shakespeare, what do you think about that?

transcript.speaker: Dawn Wells
transcript.dialogue: (laughs) That's an odd conversation... coming from the two of you.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Do you think kids named Mobley are secretly planning crimes against the world?

transcript.speaker: Dawn Wells
transcript.dialogue: Yeah! And I, you, you wouldn't know it unless somebody told ya, that somebody was thinking that.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Space Ghost.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: What now?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: I am the Lone Locust of the Apocalypse. Think of me when you look to the night sky.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: I will. (to Dawn) Dawn, you seem so nice, it must be my birthday! So, when you were added to the opening song how did you feel?

transcript.speaker: Dawn Wells
transcript.dialogue: Oh, thank God! Actually it was a political thing, we were, we weren't ostracized and kept from that in the beginning, it was Tina Louise's contract was signed before ours, and it said that, you know, nobody could be after her, so...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: So there goes Tina again, causing problems!

transcript.speaker: Dawn Wells
transcript.dialogue: (pointing and laughing) You're good, this is fun!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Yes, I am. Tell us some behind the scenes stuff, give us the dirt!

transcript.speaker: Dawn Wells
transcript.dialogue: No. I don't think there was anything really juicy that went on.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: No funny anecdotes?

transcript.speaker: Dawn Wells
transcript.dialogue: There's a cute little story about my teeth...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (laughs for a long time as if it was a joke.) Whew, boy!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Oh brother.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Alrighty! How about your book, what's your favorite recipe?

transcript.speaker: Dawn Wells
transcript.dialogue: Home made raviolis.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Say, now that's Italian. Can we come over for dinner?

transcript.speaker: Dawn Wells
transcript.dialogue: Yeah! I can make chili and everything!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: How about Zorak and Moltar?

transcript.speaker: Dawn Wells
transcript.dialogue: Oh boy, I don't know...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Then it's a date! We'll see you after the show.

transcript.speaker: Dawn Wells
transcript.dialogue: Okay! (laughs) (she disappears from the monitor)

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Space Ghost.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: What?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: I... have to potty.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You should do that before the show! What are you, a child?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: No! I am the Lone Locust of the Apocalypse. Think of me when...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: When I look to the night sky? Yeah, right. Moltar! Is the Professor ready?

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Uh, yeah.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Russel Johnson, he played the Professor.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Russell? Moltar!

transcript.speaker: Dawn Wells
transcript.dialogue: (on control room monitor, with foreign text on the screen) I wore, the two little teeth next to your front teeth were shorter than my teeth are..

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Mm Hmm.

transcript.speaker: Dawn Wells
transcript.dialogue: ... and I didn't want to grind down two good teeth and put caps on them...

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: Mm Hmm.

transcript.speaker: Dawn Wells
transcript.dialogue: But they're very expensive and they're very thin and they're very fragile and lots of times if you leave them in you make a mistake and drink coffee and chew them up...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (invisos to the control room) So this is what you're up to! Prepare your hiney for another blast from the spank ray!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (on control monitor) Yes! Yes!

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: No!

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (in studio, sitting at Space Ghost's desk) Ewww... warm seat! (monitor screen counts down, then shows "THE LOCUST COMETH" "A Film tribute to ZORAK") Let me entertain you! Roll em! Mmmmm, classic Zorak! Me in "Courtship"...

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Bill, I respect you.

transcript.speaker: Bill Bixby
transcript.dialogue: How about love?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Yeah, that too.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Me in "Gilligan"

transcript.speaker: Moltar
transcript.dialogue: (off screen) Space Ghost!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (in control room, watching the monitor) Zorak! (invisos back to set) You didn't leave any larvae on my chair did you?

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: (evil laugh)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Hold on Russell... need to get situated here... (flies to desk and sits down, chair squeaks) Okay! Do you have enough air?

transcript.speaker: Russell Johnson
transcript.dialogue: (laughs) I have enough oxygen, thank you. I am comfortable, Space Ghost. (laughs)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Good! Eh, Russell, everybody has books, tell us about your book.

transcript.speaker: Russell Johnson
transcript.dialogue: Well, I have a book out called "Here on Gilligan's Isle". It's, uh, concern's my, uh, time on the island...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: So you really were on that island. Bob and Dawn claim it wasn't real!

transcript.speaker: Russell Johnson
transcript.dialogue: (thinking) No. I had to think about that. No, it wasn't real.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Sure it wasn't! This is all a conspiracy!

transcript.speaker: Russell Johnson
transcript.dialogue: No conspiracy there...

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Quick! What is pi?

transcript.speaker: Russell Johnson
transcript.dialogue: Pi are square. Some people think they are round but they are square.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Russell rhymes with muscle.

transcript.speaker: Russell Johnson
transcript.dialogue: Oh, yeah. Yeah. (laughs) Anyway, next question please, Space Cadet.

transcript.speaker: Zorak
transcript.dialogue: Space Cadet! (insane laugh)

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Sing us a song, Russell.

transcript.speaker: Russell Johnson
transcript.dialogue: Oh! (Hums 4 bars from the "Gilligan's Island" theme) Here on Gilligan's Isle, hey!

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: All those years and you forgot the words?

transcript.speaker: Russell Johnson
transcript.dialogue: I'm sending them to you... telepathically, yes, don't you get that? Space Man, Space Master... You getting it? Yeah?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (clock ticking in background) I'm getting it alright.

transcript.speaker: Russell Johnson
transcript.dialogue: Okay.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: (clock ticks, then stops as bell sounds) We're way outta time, thanks for joining us...

transcript.speaker: Russell Johnson
transcript.dialogue: Listen, I'd, I'd like to ask you a question.

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: Go ahead, Earth boy.

transcript.speaker: Russell Johnson
transcript.dialogue: Are you related to Beavis or Butthead?

transcript.speaker: Space Ghost
transcript.dialogue: You can't say "butt" on this program! (zaps Russell off monitor)
